context: The word 'oskab' is the third-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'oskama'. It means 'knows how to', 'is able to', or simply 'can' in English. This form is used when talking about someone (he/she/it) having a skill or ability to do something. The base verb 'oskama' means 'to know how to' or 'to be skilled at'. For example, 'Ta oskab hästi laulda' means 'He knows how to sing well' or 'He can sing well'. In the dictionary definition provided, it's used in a context about someone who is good at navigating life (a person who can handle life well).
